content.question: Which of the following are the first four nonzero terms of the Maclaurin series for the function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, open parenthesis, 1 plus x, close parenthesis, times e raised to the negative x power " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 plus 2 x, plus three halves times x squared, plus two thirds times x cubed, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 plus 2 x, plus three halves times x squared, plus five sixths times x cubed, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 minus one half times x squared, plus one sixth times x cubed, minus one twelfth times x to the fourth power, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1 minus, one half, x squared, plus one third, x cubed, minus, 1 eighth, x to the fourth power, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="1 minus, one half, x squared, plus one third, x cubed, minus, 1 eighth, x to the fourth power, plus dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>⋯</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 10.14: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor or Maclaurin Series for a Function

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
